sentences.text: 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders Notice and Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Masco Corporation 21001 Van Born Road Taylor, Michigan 48180
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 313-274-7400 www.masco.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 31, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Stockholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend Masco Corporations Annual Meeting of Stockholders at 9:30 a.m. on Friday, May 12, 2017 at our corporate office in Taylor, Michigan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following pages contain information regarding the meeting schedule and the matters proposed for your consideration and vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following our formal meeting, we expect to provide a review of our operations and respond to your questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Annual Meeting agenda again includes an advisory say-on-pay vote to approve the compensation paid to our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our continued efforts to enhance our pay-for-performance practices resulted in 98% of the votes cast last year in favor of the compensation paid to our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we also continued our robust stockholder engagement program by reaching out to our largest stockholders in both the spring and in the fall to discuss a broad range of executive compensation and governance topics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge you to carefully consider the information in the proxy statement regarding the proposals to be presented at our Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote on these proposals is important, regardless of whether or not you are able to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting instructions can be found on the enclosed proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please submit your vote today by internet, telephone or mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On behalf of our entire Board of Directors, we thank you for your continued support of Masco Corporation, and we look forward to seeing you on May 12.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: J. Michael Losh Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Keith J. Allman President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THIS PROXY STATEMENT AND THE ENCLOSED PROXY CARD ARE BEING MAILED OR OTHERWISE MADE AVAILABLE TO STOCKHOLDERS ON OR ABOUT MARCH 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of the Annual Meeting are: The Company recommends that you vote as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect three Class II directors; FOR each Class II director nominee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To consider and act upon a proposal to approve the compensation paid to our named executive officers; FOR the approval of the compensation paid to our named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To consider and act upon a proposal to select the frequency with which stockholders will vote on executive compensation; The selection of 1 YEAR as the frequency with which stockholders will vote on executive compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To ratify the selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent auditors for 2017; and FOR the selection of PriceWaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent auditors for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record at the close of business on March 17, 2017 are entitled t vote at the Annual Meeting or any adjournment or postponement of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, you can ensure that your shares are represented at the meeting by promptly voting by internet or by telephone, or by completing, signing, dating and returning your proxy card in the enclosed postage prepaid envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions for each of these methods and the control number that you will need are provided on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may withdraw your proxy before it is exercised by following the directions in the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, you may vote in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kenneth G. Cole Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT SUMMARY MASCO 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary highlights information to assist you in reviewing the proposals you will be voting on at our 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary does not contain all of the information you should consider; you should read the entire proxy statement carefully before voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposals for our Annual Meeting are the election of our Class II Directors, the approval of the compensation paid to our named executive officers (who we generally refer to as our executive officers in this Proxy Statement), the frequency with which stockholders will vote on executive compensation, and the ratification of the selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent auditors for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE AND OUR BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is committed to maintaining our high standards of ethical business conduct and corporate governance principles and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate governance practices include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robust Stockholder Engagement - We reach out to our largest stockholders each spring and fall to discuss a broad range of executive compensation and governance topics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Political Contribution Oversight - In 2016, our Board adopted a Political Contributions Policy, which requires oversight by our Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee of our political contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Refreshment - Five new independent directors have joined our Board since 2012, and in 2015 our Board appointed a new Chairman of the Board and new Chairs of our Board Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Separation of our CEO and Chairman of the Board - The positions of our CEO and Chairman of the Board are currently separated; our Chairman of the Board is an independent director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Self-Evaluation - Annually, our directors review the effectiveness of our Board through a self evaluation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Voting for our Directors - In uncontested elections, our director nominees must receive more than 50% of the votes cast to be elected to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence - Eight of our ten directors are independent, and all of the members of our Audit, Organization and Compensation, and Corporate Governance and Nominating Committees are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD REFRESHMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have had significant Board refreshment over the past five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Five new independent directors have joined our Board since December 2012, bringing fresh and diverse perspectives, which, combined with our directors who have experience with us, provides a desirable balance of deep, historical understanding of our Company and new perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered strong financial results again in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our reported sales for the full year increased 3% to $7.4 billion, and we increased our operating profit margin to 14.3%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have maintained our positive momentum in 2016 across most of our business segments, and as a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of branded home improvement and building products, our longstanding commitment to innovation continues to be a key factor in our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to delivering sales and profit growth, in 2016 we returned capital to our stockholders by repurchasing nearly 15 million shares of stock and increasing our annual dividend by approximately 5%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, we continued the execution of our strategy to position us for future growth by focusing on leveraging opportunities across our businesses, driving the full potential of our core businesses and actively managing our portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our strong financial performance in 2016, we exceeded the target goals for our annual and long- term performance-based compensation programs.

sentences.text: STOCKHOLDER OUTREACH
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining our executive compensation and corporate governance practices, our Board believes it is important to consider feedback from our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we continued our robust stockholder engagement program through which we encourage certain of our stockholders to engage in dialogue with us twice per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the year, we reached out to stockholders holding over 40% of our outstanding shares, and discussed with certain of these stockholders an overview of our business strategies, board composition and refreshment, the Political Contributions Policy we adopted in 2016 and our annual and long-term performance compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We received positive feedback from the stockholders with whom we spoke regarding the structure of our compensation programs and practices, which was reflective of the strong support we have received for our say-on-pay proposal over the past four years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide reports on the feedback we receive to our Organization and Compensation Committee (Compensation Committee) and Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee (Governance Committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR COMPENSATION PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our Compensation Committee continued to review our compensation programs and practices to ensure our interests and the objectives for our compensation programs are aligned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting, 98% of the votes cast on our say-on-pay proposal approved the compensation we paid to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the say-on-pay vote is advisory and non-binding, our Compensation Committee believes this approval percentage indicates strong support for our continued efforts to enhance our pay-for-performance practices, and our Compensation Committee concluded that our stockholders endorse our current executive compensation programs and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation practices include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives - Our compensation programs are weighted toward long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We give approximately equal weight to performance-based restricted stock, stock options and our three-year LTCIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Five-Year Vesting for Equity Awards - Our performance-based restricted stock and stock option awards vest over five years, which is longer than typical market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Performance Program - A significant portion of our executive officers compensation opportunity is based on the achievement of a long-term performance goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy - If we restate our financial statements, other than as a result of changes to accounting rules or regulations, our clawback policy allows us to recover incentive compensation paid to our executives in the three-year period prior to the restatement, regardless of whether misconduct caused the restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Requirements - We have minimum stock ownership requirements for our executive officers, including requiring our CEO to own stock valued at six times his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016 each of our executive officers met his or her stock ownership requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-Trigger Vesting - We have double-trigger vesting of equity on a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally Sheets and Risk Analysis - Our Compensation Committee uses tally sheets and analyze risk in setting executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive Analysis - On an annual basis, our Compensation Committee reviews a market analysis of executive compensation paid by our peer companies and published survey data for comparably-sized companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited Perquisites - We provide limited perquisites to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT SUMMARY MASCO 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation practices do not include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excise Tax Gross-Ups - We have eliminated the excise tax gross-up feature on all of the equity grants made since 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging or Pledging - Our policy prohibits executives and directors from hedging our stock and from making future pledges of our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contractual Termination Arrangements - We have no change in control agreements, contractual severance agreements or employment agreements providing for severance payments with our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Option Repricing - Our equity plan prohibits the repricing of options without stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section of our proxy statement provides information on the qualifications and experience of our director nominees and incumbent directors, the structure of our Board and our Board committees, and other important corporate governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR AND DIRECTOR NOMINEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is divided into three classes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the election of the Class II directors nominated at this Annual Meeting, the terms of office of our Class I, Class II and Class III directors will expire at the Annual Meeting of Stockholders in 2019, 2020 and 2018, respectively, or when their respective successors are elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to meeting the criteria that are described below under Board Composition and Membership, each of our director nominees and each continuing director brings a strong and unique background and set of skills to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, our Board as a whole possesses competence and experience in a wide variety of areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Skills and Expertise Represented by our Directors and Director Nominees  Executive management  Finance and accounting  Growth strategy  Risk management  Marketing and brand management  Manufacturing  Global operations  Corporate governance and board oversight  Talent management  Portfolio strategy  Business development  Executive compensation  Legal and compliance  Government relations  Real estate development
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Keith J. Allman
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POSITION: Our President and Chief Executive Officer, since February 2014
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retired Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President of General Motors Corporation, a global automotive company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RELEVANT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RELEVANT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Allman brings to our Board strong business leadership skills, hands-on operational experience with our businesses and valuable insight into our culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He played an integral role in developing our strategies to strengthen our brands and improve our execution, which has helped to provide the foundation for the current direction of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His key leadership positions within our Company have given him deep knowledge of all aspects of our business, and he also possesses a significant understanding of, and experience with, complex operations as well as company-specific customer expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is committed to maintaining our high standards of ethical business conduct and corporate governance principles and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Facts about our Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman of the Board: J. Michael Losh
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current Chairman and CEO roles are separa
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5 Board meetings were held in 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 80% of our directors are independent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of our Audit Committee, Compensation Committee and Governance Committee is independent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 60% of our directors have joined our Board in the last 5 years
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20% of our directors are female
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The average age of our directors is 62
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Structure of our Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. J. Michael Losh was appointed as Chairman of our Board on May 4, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that time, Mr. Losh also became the Chair of our Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Losh has served on our Board since 2003, including as the Chair of our Audit Committee from 2008-2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Responsibilities of our Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an independent Chairman of our Board, Mr. Losh has a strong working relationship with the other directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His responsibilities include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presiding at Board meetings and at executive sessions of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: providing advice to our CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consulting with management regarding information sent to our Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approving our Boards meeting agendas and assuring that there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: overseeing the Boards annual review of our strategic plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: calling meetings of the independent directors, as necessary; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: overseeing our Board and Committee self-evaluation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Separation of our Chairman of the Board and CEO Roles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that its leadership structure is in the best interests of the Company and our stockholders at this time; however, our Board has no policy with respect to the separation of the roles of CEO and Chairman and believes that this matter should be discussed and determined by the Board from time to time, based on all of the then-current facts and circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the roles of Chairman and CEO are combined in the future, the role of Lead Director could become part of our Board leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications with our Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are interested in contacting the Chairman of our Board, you may send your communication in care of our Secretary to the address specified in Communications with Our Board of Directors below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PART I - CORPORATE GOVERNANCE MASCO 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines require that a majority of our directors qualify as independent under the requirements of applicable law and the New York Stock Exchanges listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence Standards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a director to be considered independent, our Board must determine that the director does not have any direct or indirect material relationship with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has adopted standards to assist it in making a determination of independence for directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These standards are posted on our website at www.masco.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assessment of our Directors Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has determined that eight of our ten current directors, including all of our non-employee directors other than Mr. Manoogian, are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an employee, Mr. Allman, our President and Chief Executive Officer, is not an independent director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our independent directors are Messrs. Alexander, Losh, OHerlihy, Parfet, Plant and Turner, Ms. Payne and Ms. Van Lokeren.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its independence determinations, our Board reviewed all transactions, relationships and arrangements for the last three fiscal years involving each non-employee director and the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating Mr. OHerlihys independence, our Board considered our purchases of goods from Illinois Tool Works Inc. and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate amount of these purchases was approximately $0.8 million in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Illinois Tool Works has reported revenue of $13.6 billion in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board does not believe that Mr. OHerlihy has a material interest in these transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board also determined that we did not make any discretionary charitable contributions exceeding the greater of $1 million or 2% of the revenues of any charitable organization in which any of our directors was actively involved in the day-to-day operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee Member Independence Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has determined that each member of our Audit Committee, Compensation Committee and Governance Committee qualifies as independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Refreshment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Committee periodically assesses the composition of our Board by reviewing the skills and expertise currently represented on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee also reviews current director tenure, including whether any vacancies are expected on our Board due to retirement or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our Board engaged in a planning exercise to provide input to our Governance Committee on our committee structure and composition and anticipated skills and expertise that would be valuable to our Board in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Refreshment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Five new independent directors have joined our Board since December 2012, bringing fresh and diverse perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These directors have particular strength in the areas of executive management, financial expertise, global operations, business strategy, brand management, risk management, labor and employment law and government relations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the addition of these new directors, combined with our directors who have experience with us, provides a desirable balance of deep, historical understanding of our Company and new perspectives, resulting in strong guidance and oversight to our executive management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MASCO 2017 PART I - CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman and Committee Refreshment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2015, our Board appointed Mr. Losh as our new independent Board Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Losh has been a member of our Board since 2003, and served as our Audit Committee Chair from 2008 to 2015, stepping down from that position when he was appointed as Chair of our Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, in May 2015, new Chairs were appointed to our Audit and Compensation Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Membership and Composition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Membership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Committee believes that directors should possess exemplary personal and professional reputations, reflecting high ethical standards and values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expertise and experience of directors should provide a source of advice and guidance to our management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A directors judgment should demonstrate an inquisitive and independent perspective with acute intelligence and practical wisdom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors should be free of any significant business relationships which would result in a potential conflict in judgment between our interests and the interests of those with whom we do business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director should be committed to serving on our Board for an extended period of time and to devoting sufficient time to carry out the directors duties and responsibilities in an effective manner for the benefit of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Committee also considers additional criteria adopted by our Board for director nominees and the independence, financial literacy and financial expertise standards required by applicable law and by the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Composition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither our Board nor our Governance Committee has adopted a formal Board diversity policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, as part of its assessment of Board composition and evaluation of potential director candidates, our Governance Committee considers whether our directors hold diverse viewpoints, professional experiences, education and other skills and attributes that are necessary to enhance Board effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Governance Committee believes that it is desirable for Board members to possess diverse characteristics of race, national and regional origin, ethnicity, gender and age, and considers such factors in its evaluation of candidates for Board membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Candidate Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee uses a number of sources to identify and evaluate director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the Governance Committees policy to consider director candidates recommended by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Board candidates, including those recommended by stockholders, are evaluated against the criteria described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders wishing to have the Governance Committee consider a candidate should submit the candidates name and pertinent background information to our Secretary at the address stated below in Communications with our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who wish to nominate director candidates for election to our Board should follow the procedures set forth in our Certificate of Incorporation and Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a summary of these procedures, see 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PART I - CORPORATE GOVERNANCE MASCO 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board oversees our risk management practices, both directly and through its Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board exercises its risk oversight through an annual review and discussion of a comprehensive analysis prepared by management on material risks facing us and related mitigating activities; updates regarding these risks are presented at each subsequent Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our President and Chief Executive Officer, as the head of our management team and a member of our Board, assists our Board in its risk oversight function and leads those discussions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key risk oversight responsibilities of our Board, Audit Committee and Compensation Committee are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors Strategic risk Operational risk Financial risk Legal, regulatory and compliance risk Audit Committee Compensation Committee  Financial reporting  Internal controls over financial reporting  Legal and regulatory compliance  Code of Ethics  Executive compensation programs and policies  CEO and executive management succession planning  Compensation risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Meetings and Attendance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board held five meetings in 2016, one of which focused primarily on reviewing our long-term strategic plan with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting Attendance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director attended at least 75% of our Board meetings and applicable committee meetings that were held in 2016 while such person served as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our policy to encourage directors to attend our Annual Meeting of Stockholders, and all of our directors except Mr. Alexander attended our 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Sessions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our non-employee directors frequently meet in executive session without management, and the independent directors meet separately at least once per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Losh, as our Chairman of the Board, presides over these executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

Cole, Secretary, Masco Corporation, 21001 Van Born Road, Taylor, MI 48180.

sentences.text: We are relocating our corporate offices, and beginning on July 1, 2017, please send communications to P.O. Box 510987, Livonia, MI 48151.

sentences.text: RELATED PERSON TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has adopted a Related Person Transaction Policy that requires our Board or a committee of independent directors to approve or ratify any transaction involving us in which any director, director nominee, executive officer, 5% beneficial owner or any of his or her immediate family members has a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Persons Transaction Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policy covers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: financial transactions and arrangements, or any series of similar transactions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: indebtedness and guarantees of indebtedness; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: transactions involving employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ur policy excludes transactions determined by our Board not to involve a material interest of the related erson, such as:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ordinary course of business transactions of $120,000 or less;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: transactions in which the related persons interest is derived from service as a director of another entity or ownership of less than 10% of another entitys stock; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: transactions in which the related persons interest is derived from service as a director, trustee or officer of a not-for-profit organization or charity that receives donations from us, which are made in accordance with our matching gifts program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assessing Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policy requires directors, director nominees and executive officers to provide prompt written notice to our Secretary of any related transaction so it can be reviewed by our Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Governance Committee determines that the related person has a direct or indirect material interest in the transaction, it will consider all relevant information to assess whether the transaction is in, or not inconsistent with, our best interests and the best interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee annually reviews previously-approved ongoing related transactions to determine whether the transactions should continue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Persons Transactions for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There have been no transactions since January 1, 2016 required to be described in this proxy statement that were not subject to review, approval or ratification in accordance with this policy.

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion & Analysis Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs are designed to promote the long-term interests of our stockholders by attracting and retaining talented executives and motivating them to achieve our business objectives and to create stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our performance, the achievement of strategic business goals and the creation of long-term stockholder value should impact a significant portion of our executive officers compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee oversees our compensation programs and the compensation paid to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW OUR 2016 FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE IMPACTED OUR EXECUTIVE OFFICERS COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered strong financial results in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our sales for the full year increased 3% to $7.4 billion, and we increased our operating profit margin to 14.3%.

sentences.text: Based on our strong financial performance in 2016, we exceeded the target goals for our performance-based compensation programs, which include:

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A LTCIP under which we make cash awards to our executive officers if we meet return on invested capital performance goals over a three-year period.

sentences.text: PART II - COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS MASCO 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion & Analysis Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR EXECUTIVE OFFICERS PERFORMANCE-BASED TARGET COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our target compensation mix for our CEO and our other executive officers reflects our emphasis on long- term, performance-based compensation that incentivizes our executive officers to make strategic decisions that will strengthen our business and create long-term value for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, 86% of our CEOs target compensation and 73% of our other executive officers target compensation was performance- based, as shown in the graphs below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR COMPENSATION PROGRAM HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation practices include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives - Our compensation programs are weighted toward long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We give approximately equal weight to performance-based restricted stock, stock options and our three-year LTCIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Five-Year Vesting for Equity Awards - Our performance-based restricted stock and stock option awards vest over five years, which is longer than typical market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Performance Program - A significant portion of our executive officers compensation opportunity is based on the achievement of a long-term performance goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy - If we restate our financial statements, other than as a result of changes to accounting rules or regulations, our clawback policy allows us to recover incentive compensation paid to our executives in the three-year period prior to the restatement, regardless of whether misconduct caused the restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Requirements - We have minimum stock ownership requirements for our executive officers, including requiring our CEO to own stock valued at six times his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016 each of our executive officers met his or her stock ownership requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-Trigger Vesting - We have double-trigger vesting of equity on a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally Sheets and Risk Analysis - Our Compensation Committee uses tally sheets and analyzes risk in setting executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MASCO 2017 PART II - COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion & Analysis Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive Analysis - On an annual basis, our Compensation Committee reviews a market analysis of executive compensation paid by our peer companies and published survey data for comparably-sized companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited Perquisites - We provide limited perquisites to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation practices do not include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excise Tax Gross-Ups - We have eliminated the excise tax gross-up feature on all of the equity grants made since 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging or Pledging - Our policy prohibits executives and directors from hedging our stock and from making future pledges of our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contractual Termination Arrangements - We have no change in control agreements, contractual severance agreements or employment agreements providing for severance payments with our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Option Repricing - Our equity plan prohibits the repricing of options without stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STOCKHOLDER ENGAGEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting, 98% of the votes cast on our say-on-pay proposal approved the compensation we paid to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the say-on-pay vote is advisory and non-binding, our Compensation Committee believes this approval percentage indicates strong support for our continued efforts to enhance our pay-for-performance practices, and our Compensation Committee concluded that our stockholders endorse our current executive compensation programs and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we continued our robust stockholder engagement program through which we encourage certain of our stockholders to engage in dialogue with us twice per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the year, we reached out to stockholders holding over 40% of our outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We received positive feedback from the stockholders with whom we spoke regarding the structure of our compensation programs and practices, which was reflective of the strong support we received for our say-on-pay proposal over the past four years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide reports on the feedback we receive to our Compensation Committee and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PART II - COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS MASCO 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DECISIONS IN 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 Financial Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered strong financial results again in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our reported sales for the full year increased 3% to $7.4 billion, and we increased our operating profit margin to 14.3%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have maintained our positive momentum in 2016 across most of our business segments, and as a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of branded home improvement and building products, our longstanding commitment to innovation continues to be a key factor in our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to delivering sales and profit growth, in 2016 we returned capital to our stockholders by repurchasing nearly 15 million shares of stock and increasing our annual dividend by approximately 5%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, we continued the execution of our strategy to position us for future growth by focusing on leveraging opportunities across our businesses, driving the full potential of our core businesses and actively managing our portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Performed Against our Performance Compensation Goals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 annual performance program was based on operating profit and working capital as a percent of sales metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We exceeded the target goals for this program and achieved a performance percentage of 141%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, consistent with our commitment to pay-for-performance, our executive officers earned restricted stock awards and cash bonuses based on this achievement (see Our 2016 Annual Performance Program below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our LTCIP for the three-year period from 2014 to 2016 was based on a return on invested capital (ROIC) metric, and we significantly improved our ROIC over the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our adjusted ROIC in 2014, 2015 and 2016 was 10.6%, 11.6%, and 14.0%, respectively, for an average adjusted ROIC of 12.1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This level of performance exceeded the target goal for this program, and we achieved a performance percentage of 132% (see Our Long Term Cash Incentive Program below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 Annual Performance Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Program Opportunities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide annual performance-based restricted stock and cash bonus opportunities to our executive officers to emphasize achievement of rigorous annual performance goals, provide incentive to achieve our critical business objectives, and align our executive officers interests with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee establishes the restricted stock and cash bonus opportunities available to each executive officer as a percent of the officers annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive officer can earn up to the maximum opportunity as both a restricted stock award and a cash bonus payment.

sentences.text: Performance Metrics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee selected operating profit and working capital as a percent of sales metrics for our annual 2016 performance program because it believed that improvement in these metrics would continue to drive stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These metrics are easily derived from our audited financial statements, which our Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MASCO 2017 PART II - COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee believes provides transparency both for our stockholders (as requested from stockholders when we sought feedback) and our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee gave a 75% weighting to the operating profit metric and a 25% weighting to the working capital as a percent of sales metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Program Targets and Achievement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting our performance targets, our Compensation Committee reviews our operating forecast for the year, taking into account general economic and industry conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In establishing the 2016 performance targets, it was expected there would be an improvement in the overall economy, that consumer spending for both large and small home improvement projects and housing starts would increase in 2016 and that there would be improved performance from all of our businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee also expected that we would continue to incur incremental expenses related to growth investments and the launch of new programs with our retail and dealer customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our strong financial performance in 2016, we achieved 147% of our operating profit target and 120% of our working capital as a percent of sales target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After weighting the operating profit metric at 75% and the working capital as a percent of sales metric at 25%, our actual performance percentage for the 2016 annual performance program was 141% of target:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To determine achievement of our operating profit performance target, we adjusted our 2016 reported operating profit from continuing operations of $1,053 million by $16 million for rationalization charges and other items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our operating profit for purposes of the annual performance program was $1,069 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To determine achievement of our working capital as a percent of sales performance target, we define working capital as a percent of sales as the quarter-end averages of our reported accounts receivable and inventories, less accounts payable, divided by our reported sales for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, our working capital as a percent of sales was 12.6%.

sentences.text: Program Opportunities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a LTCIP that provides a meaningful incentive for our executive officers to achieve long-term growth and profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A performance award in cash is earned under the LTCIP if we achieve a performance goal over a three- year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Metric
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee chose the ROIC performance metric because ROIC reinforces our executive officers focus on capital efficiency and consistent return on capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, our stockholders have told us that ROIC is a measure of importance to them in their assessment of our long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Program Targets and Achievement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee established the following ROIC goals and corresponding payout percentages for the 2014-2016, 2015-2017 and 2016-2018 LTCIP performance periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These performance goals are consistent with our long-range business plan and require a high level of performance to achieve:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three-Year Average ROIC Threshold (40% Payout) Target (100% Payout) Maximum (200% Payout) 2014-2016 Performance Period (adjusted after TopBuild spin off) 7.50% 10.50% 15.50% 2015-2017 Performance Period (adjusted after TopBuild spin off) 9.00% 12.00% 17.00% 2016-2018 Performance Period 9.00% 12.00% 17.00%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee establishes performance goals at the beginning of each three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the spin off of TopBuild Corp., our Compensation Committee determined it was appropriate to adjust the ROIC goals for the 2014-2016 and 2015-2017 performance periods to reflect the change in our business as a result of the spin off.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although our Compensation Committee determined to keep the 2016-2018 performance period goals the same as the prior three-year performance period, our Compensation Committee believes we will need to continue to produce strong operating profit growth to achieve a high level of return on invested capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of ROIC for our LTCIP in conjunction with operating profit growth goals in our annual performance program helps ensure our executive officers are encouraged to make new, profitable investments to achieve these goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 2014 to 2016, we substantially improved our ROIC through our improved operating performance, cost reductions, restructuring activities, product innovations, new product introductions and market share gains.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: result, we achieved adjusted ROIC of 14.0% in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the LTCIP, we use the average annual ROIC performance over a three-year period to determine the award amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our average adjusted ROIC was 12.1% for the 2014-2016 performance period, resulting in a performance percentage of 132%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Metric Threshold (40% Payout) Target (100% Payout) Maximum (200% Payout) Performance Percentage Return on Invested Capital 7.5% 10.5% 15.5% 132% 12.1%

sentences.text: Under the LTCIP, we define ROIC as after-tax operating income from continuing operations adjusted to exclude the effect of special charges and certain other non-recurring income and expenses, divided by adjusted invested capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted invested capital includes shareholders equity, which we adjust to add back the cumulative after-tax impact of goodwill and intangible asset impairment charges and to exclude the impact of certain non-operating income and expenses and the effects of special charges, plus short-term and long-term debt minus cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee believes that these adjustments are important to reflect our actual investment at the time we invested in our current businesses.

sentences.text: Other Components of our Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay our executive officers a base salary to provide each of them with a minimum, base level of cash compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our Compensation Committee engaged its independent compensation consultant, Semler Brossy Consulting Group, LLC (Semler Brossy), to perform a comprehensive analysis of CEO pay levels within our peer group, as well as for similarly situated companies outside of that group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this analysis and our Boards assessment of Mr. Allmans performance, our Compensation Committee determined that Mr. Allmans salary of $1,100,000 should be increased 5% to $1,155,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee also approved a 3% increase in 2016 for Mr. Sznewajs, our Vice President, Chief Financial Officer, adjusting his salary from $644,000 to $663,300, and for Mr. Cole, our Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary, adjusting his salary from $415,000 to $427,500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved an 8% market increase in 2016 for Mr. OReagan, our Group President, Global Plumbing, adjusting his salary from $463,500 to $500,000 and a 10% market increase for Mr. Kastner, our Vice President, Masco Operating System, adjusting his salary from $350,000 to $385,000 and increasing his target incentive percentages from 50% to 55%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the appropriate compensation adjustments for our executive officers, our Compensation Committee conducts a review with our CEO of the performance and contributions of our executive officers in the prior year; considers market survey data in published executive compensation surveys for companies with annual revenues similar to ours and significant changes in the scope and complexity of the executive officers role; and receives input from Semler Brossy.

sentences.text: Retirement Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain the following defined contribution retirement plans for all of our employees, including our executive officers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 401(k) Savings Plan: Our 401(k) Savings Plan is a tax-qualified plan that includes a matching component and a profit sharing component.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Restoration Plan (BRP): Our BRP enables all of our highly-compensated employees to obtain the full financial benefit of the 401(k) Savings Plan, notwithstanding various limitations imposed on the plans under the Internal Revenue Code (the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers may also be entitled to receive benefits under the following frozen defined benefit plans:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Masco Corporation Pension Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BRP applicable to the Masco Corporation Pension Plan; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (SERP): Mr. Sznewajs is the only current executive officer who may receive benefits under a SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2010, we froze accruals in all of these plans, as well as in all of our other defined benefit plans offered to our U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, the pension benefits ultimately payable to all executive officers are essentially fixed, although Mr. Sznewajss vesting in the frozen accrued SERP benefit has continued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Sznewajs will not be fully vested in his frozen SERP benefit unless he continues to be employed with us until he is age 55, or we have a change in control (see Payments Upon a Change in Control below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROGRAM HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Provide Long-Term Equity Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that having a significant ownership interest in our stock is critical to aligning the interests of our executive officers with the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, restricted stock awards and stock options are an important component of our executive officers compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity awards are priced based on the closing price on the date of grant, unless the grant date occurs within seven days prior to the release of our financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that event, the grant is effective at the end of the second trading day after the release of the results and priced based on the closing price of our common stock on that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity awards vest in 20% installments over five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Five-year vesting defers the executives realization of the full benefit of equity-based compensation for a substantial period of time and is longer than typical market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value our executive officers ultimately realize from equity awards depends on the long-term performance of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, equity awards do not vest immediately upon retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, following retirement, equity awards generally continue to vest in accordance with the remaining vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers understand that our performance will continue to impact them financially even after they retire, thereby reinforcing their focus on the long-term enhancement of stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Have a Long-Term Performance Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through our stockholder engagement we have learned that our stockholders strongly support a performance compensation program that measures performance over several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this feedback, we implemented our LTCIP, which measures performance over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2014-2016 performance period we measured performance based on ROIC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, a significant portion of our executive officers compensation opportunity is based on the achievement of a long-term performance goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PART II - COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS MASCO 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Can Clawback Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we restate our financial statements, other than as a result of changes to accounting rules or regulations, our Compensation Committee may recover from our executives incentive compensation that was paid or granted in the three-year period prior to the restatement, regardless of whether misconduct caused the restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Require Minimum Levels of Stock Ownership by our Executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We require minimum stock ownership for our executive officers to further reinforce the alignment of their long-term financial interests with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This requirement ensures that our executive officers maintain a substantial investment in our common stock and that a meaningful amount of each executive officers personal net worth is invested in our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are required to achieve the stock ownership necessary to meet the stock ownership requirements within three years of becoming subject to them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee reviews our executive officers ownership of our common stock annually to ensure compliance with our stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers direct stock holdings and unvested restricted stock awards are counted toward satisfaction of the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, when the closing price of our common stock was $31.62, each of our executive officers met the stock ownership requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Adopted Double-Trigger Change of Control Provisions for our Equity Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of our equity awards granted after 2012 provide that the awards will vest only if there is both a change in control of our Company and the recipient of the award is terminated from employment at the time of the change in control or within two years after the change in control, or terminates employment for good reason (for example, if his or her job duties have been significantly diminished) (double-trigger vesting), or if the recipients awards are not replaced with comparable awards by the acquiring company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee Conducts an Annual Compensation Risk Evaluation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee annually conducts a risk assessment of our compensation programs, including our executive compensation programs, focusing on the components of our compensation programs and analyzing whether those components present undue risk to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our Compensation Committee reviewed its risk assessment process to assure it reflects current best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this review, our Compensation Committee incorporated in its risk assessment consideration of our material business risks and their potential impact on our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has concluded that our programs do not encourage excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the total compensation program is designed to balance short- and long-term rewards, the largest portion of the compensation opportunity for our executive officers is through equity- and cash-based long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers are also required to own a substantial amount of our stock to further encourage a long-term perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual cash bonus and stock award programs and our LTCIP have established maximum payout opportunities in line with competitive practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MASCO 2017 PART II - COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Structure of our Compensation Programs Encourages Executive Retention and Protects Us
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe several features of our compensation programs, including the terms and conditions of our equity plan, improve our retention of our executive officers and also reduce the potential that executive officers might engage in post-termination conduct that would be harmful to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers generally forfeit unvested awards of restricted stock and stock options when their employment terminates prior to retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers may exercise vested options for a limited period of time following termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of our awards prohibit our executive officers from competing with us for one year after termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an executive officer violates this restriction, we can recover the gain the executive officer realized from awards that vested within two years prior to termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Prohibit Excise Tax Gross-Up Payments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has adopted a policy prohibiting excise tax gross-up payments, except for such payments committed to in equity awards and frozen SERP agreements entered into prior to 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, equity awards made in 2012 and thereafter will no longer be included for purposes of determining future excise tax gross-up payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the exception of tax equalization gross-up payments made to employees in connection with reimbursement of relocation or foreign expatriate expenses incurred at our request, we do not provide other tax gross-up payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Prohibit Hedging and Pledging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our anti-hedging and anti-pledging policy prohibits our executive officers and our directors from engaging in any hedging transactions (including transactions involving options, puts, calls, prepaid variable forward contracts, equity swaps, collars and exchange funds or other derivatives) that are designed to hedge or speculate on any change in the market value of our equity or debt securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, our executive officers and directors are prohibited from making any future purchases of our securities on margin or from pledging our securities as collateral for a loan, unless the arrangement is preapproved by our Governance Committee for any executive or by our Board for any director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Do Not Have Contractual Termination Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers do not have employment contracts and are at-will employees who may be terminated at our discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this preserves greater flexibility in our employment arrangements with our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers also do not have change in control or severance contracts, although we have, from time to time, entered into severance arrangements with departing executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For further discussion regarding change in control, see Payments Upon Change In Control below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR ANNUAL COMPENSATION REVIEW PROCESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We review and make decisions regarding the amount of eligible annual performance-based restricted stock awards, cash bonus payments and stock option grants in the first quarter of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that determining these elements of compensation together at the beginning of the year gives us a better foundation for establishing our performance criteria and opportunity levels for the current year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice also better enables our Compensation Committee to determine our executive officers appropriate compensation mix and to align compensation with ongoing talent review and development in conjunction with our annual management talent review and development process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Management Talent Review and Development Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual management talent review and development process is used by our Compensation Committee and our CEO in making compensation decisions and for succession planning purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this process, our CEO provides our Compensation Committee with an assessment of each executive who reports to him.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assessment includes an evaluation of each executives performance, development, progress
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PART II - COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS MASCO 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and plans and potential for advancement, and considers market demand for the executives skill set.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee also receives information, analyses and recommendations from our Vice President, Chief Human Resource Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our Compensation Committee gives significant weight to the evaluations by our CEO, the final determination of compensation to be paid to our executive officers, including our CEO, rests solely with our Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Data Considered by our Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally Sheets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee reviews a tally sheet that summarizes the various components of total compensation for our executive officers and other members of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tally sheet includes base salary, annual performance-based restricted stock and cash bonus, LTCIP awards, stock options, dividends on unvested shares of restricted stock, and our costs for the foregoing and for perquisites and other benefits, including the annual costs under retirement plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tally sheet allows our Compensation Committee to compare an executive officers compensation with the compensation of our other executive officers as part of its consideration of internal and external pay equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts actually realized by an executive officer from prior equity grants are not necessarily a factor in establishing current compensation, although the current value of outstanding equity awards may be considered by our Compensation Committee when assessing pay equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market Data
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee also reviews compensation for each of our executive officers with compensation information disclosed in the proxy statements of our peer group and with AonHewitts and Willis Towers Watsons published compensation surveys for companies with annual revenues between $5 and $10 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When we achieve targeted levels of performance, our executive compensation program seeks to provide total target compensation (base salary, target annual bonus and the target value of long-term incentives) at approximately the median compensation level provided to executives in comparable positions at these companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our Compensation Committee generally targets total compensation for each executive officer at the median, it considers other factors, such as performance, the officers roles and responsibilities and the length of time the officer has served in the current position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee also reviews actual compensation paid as reported in published surveys and by our peer group to help inform individual pay decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe understanding market data allows us to attract and retain the talent we need while enabling us to manage our compensation expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual compensation is defined as the sum of base salary, actual cash bonuses paid under our annual program and under our LTCIP, and the grant date fair value of restricted stock awards and stock options.

sentences.text: Retention of Discretion by our Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our approach to executive compensation emphasizes corporate rather than individual performance, echoing our operating strategy that encourages collaboration and cooperation among our businesses and corporate functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the effectiveness of our executive compensation programs requires not only objective, formula-based arrangements, but also the exercise of discretion and sound business judgment by our Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, our Compensation Committee retains discretion to adjust the mix of cash and equity compensation, adjust the mix of restricted stock and stock options awarded, and offer different forms of equity-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With this discretion, our Compensation Committee is best able to reward the individual contributions of each executive officer and to respond to an executives expanding responsibilities, market practices and our changing business needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to granting performance-based restricted stock based on prior year performance, our Compensation Committee also has the discretion to award shares of time-based restricted stock to our executive officers, other than our CEO, if it determines that an executive officer has made outstanding individual contributions during the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total value of these awards cannot exceed 20% of the combined annual base salaries of the executive officers (excluding the salary of our CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No discretionary awards were made in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outside Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee has engaged Semler Brossy as its compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Semler Brossy was chosen by our Compensation Committee based on its deep experience in the area of executive compensation and its creative and proactive approach in analyzing executive compensation practices and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Semler Brossy attended Compensation Committee meetings, met with our Compensation Committee in executive sessions without our executive officers or other members of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PART II - COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS MASCO 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: management, met individually with our Compensation Committee members and our Compensation Committee Chair, and advised our Compensation Committee on its overall implementation of our compensation objectives, on the Companys peer group, on director compensation practices and on the compensation for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the factors promulgated by the SEC for assessing the independence of its advisers, our Compensation Committee has determined that the work of Semler Brossy has not raised any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TAX TREATMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code limits deductibility of annual compensation in excess of $1 million paid to our executive officers, unless this compensation qualifies as performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholder-approved plan permits our Compensation Committee to grant cash and equity awards intended to qualify under Section 162(m) so that they may be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee, however, believes it is in our interest to retain flexibility in our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, in some circumstances, we have paid and intend to continue to pay compensation that may not qualify as deductible under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CONCLUSION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize the importance of attracting and retaining executive officers who can effectively lead our business, and in motivating them to maximize our corporate performance and create long-term value for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe in rewarding our executive officers to a significant degree based on our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to thoughtfully and thoroughly analyze our compensation practices and programs and to regularly reach out to a significant number of our stockholders to understand their perspectives regarding our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our compensation practices and programs strongly align our executive officers interests with the long-term interests of stockholders, reward our executive officers based on our performance and incentivize them to focus on our critical business objectives.
